    • Method Detail

      • getOutput

        public static byte[] getOutput(java.lang.String algorithm,
               java.util.List<byte[]> inputs,
               int[] inputOrder)
        Valid inputs are:
        • SHA1
        • SHA256
        • SHA224
        • SHA384
        • SHA512
        • AES/CBC/ENC
        • AES/CBC/DEC
        • AES/CFB128/ENC
        • AES/CFB128/DEC
        • AES/CFB8/ENC
        • AES/CFB8/DEC
        • AES/ECB/ENC
        • AES/ECB/DEC
        • AES/OFB/ENC
        • AES/OFB/DEC
        • RNG/AES
        • RNG/TDES2
        • RNG/TDES3
        • HMAC
        Parameters:
        algorithm - String name of the algorithm.
        inputs - possibly out of order superset of the inputs to the algorithm
        inputOrder - integers pointing to the inputs to the algorithm in order
        Returns:
        the output of the algorithm on its inputs

      • rng

        public static byte[] rng(byte[] key,
         byte[] dt,
         byte[] v,
         java.lang.String alg)
        Wrapper function for the Rng class
        Parameters:
        key - the secret key
        dt - the date time vector
        v - the seed
        alg - the java/bouncycastle algorithm to use
        Returns:
        next random bytes generated by the inputs

      • digestBouncyCastle

        public static byte[] digestBouncyCastle(java.lang.String algorithm,
                        byte[] message)
        Parameters:
        algorithm - BouncyCastle algorithm name
        message - message to be digested
        Returns:
        message digest

      • cypherBouncyCastle

        public static byte[] cypherBouncyCastle(java.lang.String algorithm,
                        int mode,
                        byte[] seckey,
                        byte[] iv,
                        byte[] msg)
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Bouncy Castle algorithm name
        mode - Cipher encrypt or decrypt mode
        seckey - Secret key
        iv - Initialization Vector
        msg - The message to be encrypted or decrypted
        Returns:
        the msg encrypted/decrypted by the given algorithm

      • hmacBouncyCastle

        public static byte[] hmacBouncyCastle(int outlen,
                      byte[] seckey,
                      byte[] msg)
        Run BouncyCastle HMAC
        Parameters:
        outlen - the output length in bytes. This decides which HMAC to run
        seckey - the secret key
        msg - the message being authenticated
        Returns:
        the MAC
